autoGenerated.description: if true, a secret object will be generated with auto-generated passwords. This secret object is NOT managed with corresponding releases and NOR part of Helm deployment/upgrade! It's generated once, and if it's deleted, you will lose the secrets.

name.description: defines the name of the secret object that has the auto-generated passwords.

key.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.license.secret instead) if set, it will be exposed as "CAMUNDA_LICENSE_KEY" in the apps.

existingSecret.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.license.secret instead) you can provide an existing secret name for Camunda license secret.

existingSecretKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.license.secret instead) you can provide the key within the existing secret object for Camunda license key.

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the license as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the license.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

adaptSecurityContext.description: Adapt the securityContext sections of the deployment to make them compatible with Openshift restricted-v2 SCC: remove runAsUser, runAsGroup and fsGroup and let the platform use their allowed default IDs. Possible values: force (perform the adaptation always), disabled (do not perform adaptation)

enabled.description: if true, enables compatibility layer for Camunda Orchestration Cluster between Camunda 8.7 chart (12.x.x) and Camunda 8.8 chart (13.x.x).

requestBodySize.description: defines applications request body size which used for upload files.

enabled.description: if true, then enable multitenancy in all applicable components.

method.description: defines the authentication method which should be used. Possible values: basic, oidc. Could be overridden in each component.

createReleaseInfo.description: Create config that will be used in Camunda Console.

annotations.description: Annotations can be used to define common annotations, which should be applied to all deployments

commonLabels.description: can be used to apply mutable labels to all Camunda resources.

nodeSelector.description: can be used to define Kubernetes node selectors to run Camunda components, unless overridden by component-specific nodeSelector.

registry.description: Can be used to set container image registry.

tag.description: defines the tag / version which should be used in the most of the apps.

pullPolicy.description: defines the image pull policy which should be used https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/#image-pull-policy

pullSecrets.description: can be used to configure image pull secrets https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

enabled.description: if true, an ingress resource is deployed. Only useful if an ingress controller is available, like Ingress-NGINX.

external.description: if true, the Ingress object will not be rendered. This setting is used when a non-Ingress resource, like a service mesh, is used to access the cluster.

className.description: Ingress.className defines the class or configuration of ingress which should be used by the controller

host.description: If not specified the rules applies to all inbound http traffic, if specified the rule applies to that host.

pathType.description: can be used to define the Ingress path type. https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/ingress/#path-types

enabled.description: if true, then tls is configured on the ingress resource. If enabled the Ingress.host need to be defined.

secretName.description: defines the secret name which contains the TLS private key and certificate

enabled.description: if true, enables elasticsearch for all components

external.description: if true, tries to connect to an external elasticsearch

enabled.description: enable tls for external elasticsearch

existingSecret.description: provide an already existing tls secret for connecting to external elasticsearch
can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the jks password.

existingSecretKey.description: can be used to provide the key within the existing secret object.

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the jks password as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

password.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.elasticsearch.auth.secret instead) the password for external elasticsearch

existingSecret.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.elasticsearch.auth.secret instead) you can provide an existing secret for the external elasticsearch password

existingSecretKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.elasticsearch.auth.secret instead) you can provide an existing secret key for the external elasticsearch password

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the password as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the password.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

disableExporter.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.elasticsearch.enabled instead) this value is not needed anymore.

host.description: Elasticsearch.host defines the elasticsearch host, ideally the service name inside the namespace

port.description: Elasticsearch.port defines the elasticsearch port, under which elasticsearch can be accessed

clusterName.description: defines the name of the Elasticsearch cluster.

prefix.description: defines the prefix which is used by the old Zeebe Elasticsearch Exporter to create Elasticsearch indexes and consumed by Optimize.

enabled.description: enabled external opensearch
Enabling AWS IRSA
enable tls for external opensearch

existingSecret.description: provide an already existing tls secret for connecting to external opensearch
can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the jks password.

existingSecretKey.description: can be used to provide the key within the existing secret object.

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the jks password as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

password.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.opensearch.auth.secret instead) the password for external opensearch

existingSecret.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.opensearch.auth.secret instead) you can provide an existing secret for the external opensearch password

existingSecretKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.opensearch.auth.secret instead) you can provide an existing secret key for the external opensearch password

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the password as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the password.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

protocol.description: defines the external opensearch access protocol

host.description: defines the external opensearch host, ideally the service name inside the namespace

port.description: defines the external opensearch port, under which opensearch can be accessed

clusterName.description: defines the name of the OpenSearch cluster.

prefix.description: defines the prefix which is used by the old Zeebe OpenSearch Exporter to create OpenSearch indexes and consumed by Optimize.

zeebeClusterName.description: ZeebeClusterName defines the cluster name for the Zeebe cluster. All Zeebe pods get this prefix in their name and the brokers uses that as cluster name.

internal.description: It's useful for using existing Keycloak in another namespace with and access it with the combined Ingress.

url.description: can be used incorporate with "identityKeycloak.enabled: false" to use your own Keycloak instead of the one comes with Camunda Helm chart.

contextPath.description: In Keycloak v16.x.x it's hard-coded as '/auth', but in v19.x.x it's '/'.

realm.description: defines Keycloak realm path used for Camunda.

auth.description: same as "identityKeycloak.auth" but it's used for existing Keycloak.

enabled.description: if true, enables authentication on Management Identity .

issuer.description: defines the issuer name, which is used by the services to validate the JWT tokens.

issuerBackendUrl.description: defines the issuer backend URL, which is used by the services to validate the JWT tokens in a container to container context.

authUrl.description: defines the authentication URL, which is used by the services to to obtain authorized access.

tokenUrl.description: defines the token URL, which is used by the services to request JWT tokens.

jwksUrl.description: defines the JWKS URL, which is used by the services to validate the JWT tokens.

type.description: defines the type of authentication which should be used. Possible values: `KEYCLOAK`, `MICROSOFT`, or `GENERIC`.

publicIssuerUrl.description: Can be overwritten if ingress is in use and an external IP is available.

enabled.description: if true, creates the admin client which is used in administration operations if needed.

existingSecretKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.identity.auth.admin.secret instead) defines the key within the existing secret object.

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the client secret as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the client secret.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

clientId.description: defines the client id, which is used by Management Identity in authentication flows.

audience.description: defines the audience, which is used by Management Identity.

existingSecretKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.identity.auth.identity.secret instead) defines the key within the existing secret object.

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the client secret as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the client secret. This should ONLY be used for an external OIDC provider. If not set, a random secret is generated.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

initialClaimName.description: defines the initial claim name, which is used by Management Identity to configure initial mapping rules,

initialClaimValue.description: defines the initial claim value, which is used by Management  Identity to configure initial mapping rules.

clientId.description: defines the client id, which is used by Console in authentication flows.

audience.description: defines the audience which is used by Console's client API.

wellKnown.description: defines the uri for the well known config which is used by Console (optional).

redirectUrl.description: defines the root URL which is used by Keycloak to access WebModeler.

clientId.description: defines the client id, which is used by WebModeler in authentication flows.

clientApiAudience.description: defines the audience which is used by WebModeler's client API.

publicApiAudience.description: defines the audience which is used by WebModeler's public API.

redirectUrl.description: defines the root URL which is used by Keycloak to access WebModeler.

audience.description: defines the audience, which is used by Optimize.

clientId.description: defines the client id, which is used by Optimize in authentication flows.

existingSecretKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.identity.auth.optimize.secret instead) defines the key within the existing secret object.

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the client secret as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the client secret.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

redirectUrl.description: defines the root (or redirect) URL, which is used by Keycloak to access Optimize.

activeStoreId.description: The default document store to use. Valid values: inmemory, aws, and gcp.

enabled.description: Enable AWS document store configuration.

storeId.description: Custom prefix for AWS. Default will generate env vars containing 'storeId' such as DOCUMENT_STORE_AWS_CLASS.

region.description: AWS region for the S3 bucket. (example: us-east-1)

bucket.description: Name of the AWS S3 bucket.

bucketTtl.description: (Optional) Time-to-live for documents in the S3 bucket (number in days).

class.description: Fully qualified class name for the AWS document store provider.

existingSecret.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.documentStore.type.aws.accessKeyId.secret and global.documentStore.type.aws.secretAccessKey.secret instead) Reference to an existing Kubernetes secret containing AWS credentials.

accessKeyIdKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.documentStore.type.aws.accessKeyId.secret instead) Key within the AWS credentials secret for AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID.

secretAccessKeyKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.documentStore.type.aws.secretAccessKey.secret instead) Key within the AWS credentials secret for AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the access key ID as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the access key ID.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the secret access key as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the secret access key.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

enabled.description: Enable GCP document store configuration.

storeId.description: Custom prefix for GCP. Default will generate env vars containing 'storeId' such as DOCUMENT_STORE_GCP_CLASS.

class.description: Fully qualified class name for the GCP document store provider.

existingSecret.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.documentStore.type.gcp.serviceAccount.secret instead) Reference to an existing Kubernetes secret containing GCP credentials.

credentialsKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use global.documentStore.type.gcp.serviceAccount.secret instead) Key in the GCP credentials secret that contains the service-account JSON.

mountPath.description: Mount path for the GCP credentials secret.

fileName.description: The file name for the GCP credentials JSON.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the service account JSON.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

enabled.description: Enable in-memory document store configuration.

storeId.description: Custom prefix for in-memory. Default will generate env vars containing 'storeId' such as DOCUMENT_STORE_INMEMORY_CLASS.

class.description: Fully qualified class name for the in-memory document store provider.

extraManifests.description: Array of extra objects to deploy with the release.

noSecondaryStorage.description: if true, enables engine-only/no-secondary-storage mode; this disables all secondary-storage-dependent features and components.

enabled.description: if true, the identity deployment and its related resources are deployed via a helm release

fullnameOverride.description: can be used to override the full name of the Management Identity resources

nameOverride.description: can be used to partly override the name of the Management Identity resources (names will still be prefixed with the release name)

enabled.description: if true, Management Identity will seed the first user in Keycloak.

username.description: defines the username of the first user, needed to log in into the web applications

password.description: (DEPRECATED - use identity.firstUser.secret instead) defines the password of the first user, needed to log in into the web applications

email.description: defines the email address of the first user; a valid email address is required to use WebModeler

firstName.description: defines the first name of the first user; a name is required to use WebModeler

lastName.description: defines the last name of the first user; a name is required to use WebModeler

existingSecret.description: (DEPRECATED - use identity.firstUser.secret instead) can be used to use an own existing secret for Management Identity first user.

existingSecretKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use identity.firstUser.secret instead) defines the key within the existing secret object.

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the password as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the password.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

users.description: configuration to configure properties of the Management Identity users, which can be used to access web applications.

clients.description: configuration to configure properties of the Management Idnetity custom clients.

registry.description: can be used to set container image registry.

repository.description: defines which image repository to use

tag.description: can be set to overwrite the global tag, which should be used in that chart

digest.description: can be used to set image digest (overrides tag if set, e.g. "sha256:abcd...")

pullSecrets.description: can be used to configure image pull secrets https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

enabled.description: can be used to enable multitenancy in management identity

sidecars.description: can be used to attach extra containers to the identity deployment

initContainers.description: can be used to set up extra init containers for the application Pod

fullURL.description: can be used when Ingress is configured (for both multi and single domain setup).

contextPath.description: can be used to make Management Identity web application works on a custom sub-path. This is mainly used to run Camunda web applications under a single domain.

podAnnotations.description: can be used to define extra Management Identity pod annotations

podLabels.description: can be used to define extra Management Identity pod labels

annotations.description: can be used to define annotations, which will be applied to the identity service

type.description: defines the type of the service https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#publishing-services-service-types

port.description: defines the port of the service on which the identity application will be available

metricsPort.description: defines the port of the service on which the identity metrics will be available

metricsName.description: defines the name of the service on which the identity metrics will be available

enabled.description: if true, the startup probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe schema used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the startup probe route used on the app

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before the probe is initiated.

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be marked as ready, after failure

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the Pod will be marked Unready

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

enabled.description: if true, the readiness probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe schema used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the readiness probe route used on the app

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before the probe is initiated.

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be marked as ready, after failure

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the Pod will be marked Unready

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

enabled.description: if true, the liveness probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe schema used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the liveness probe route used on the app

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be considered successful after having failed

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the container will be restarted

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

nodeSelector.description: can be used to define on which nodes the Management Identity pods should run

tolerations.description: can be used to define pod toleration's https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/

affinity.description: can be used to define pod affinity or anti-affinity https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/#affinity-and-anti-affinity

env.description: can be used to set extra environment variables in the app container. See the documentation https://docs.camunda.io/docs/self-managed/identity/deployment/configuration-variables/ for more details.

valueFrom.description: Source for the environment variable's value

envFrom.description: list of environment variables to import from configMapRef and secretRef

command.description: can be used to override the default command provided by the container image. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/

extraVolumes.description: can be used to define extra volumes for the identity pods, useful for tls and self-signed certificates

extraVolumeMounts.description: can be used to mount extra volumes for the identity pods, useful for tls and self-signed certificates

enabled.description: if true, enables the identity service account

name.description: can be used to set the name of the identity service account

annotations.description: can be used to set the annotations of the identity service account

automountServiceAccountToken.description: can be used to control whether the service account token should be automatically mounted

password.description: (DEPRECATED - use identity.externalDatabase.secret instead) Password for the non-root username

existingSecret.description: (DEPRECATED - use identity.externalDatabase.secret instead) Name of an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the external database credentials for Management Identity.

existingSecretPasswordKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use identity.externalDatabase.secret instead) Name of an existing secret key containing the database credentials

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the password as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the password.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

configuration.description: if specified, contents will be used as the application.yaml

extraConfiguration.description: if specified, contents will be used for any extra configuration files such as the log4j2.xml

enabled.description: can be used to create a PVC for persistent storage instead of using emptyDir

size.description: can be used to define the size of the persistent volume claim

accessModes.description: can be used to define the access modes for the persistent volume claim

storageClassName.description: can be used to define the storage class to use for the persistent volume claim

existingClaim.description: can be used to specify an existing PVC instead of creating a new one

annotations.description: can be used to define annotations to add to the persistent volume claim

selector.description: can be used to define a label selector for the persistent volume claim

enabled.description: Enable Management Identity PostgreSQL Helm chart. Required for Multi-Tenancy.

adaptSecurityContext.description: Adapt the securityContext sections of the deployment to make them compatible with Openshift restricted-v2 SCC: remove runAsUser, runAsGroup and fsGroup and let the platform use their allowed default IDs. Possible values: force (perform the adaptation always), disabled (do not perform adaptation)

digest.description: can be used to set image digest (overrides tag if set, e.g. "sha256:abcd...")

nameOverride.description: the name used for Management Identity PostgreSQL.

existingSecret.description: Name of an existing secret resource containing the database credentials

adminPasswordKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object for PostgreSQL admin.

userPasswordKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object for PostgreSQL user.

enabled.description: Enable Management Identity Keycloak Helm chart. It is used incorporate with "global.identity.keycloak" to use your own Keycloak instead of the one comes with Camunda Helm chart

adaptSecurityContext.description: Adapt the securityContext sections of the deployment to make them compatible with Openshift restricted-v2 SCC: remove runAsUser, runAsGroup and fsGroup and let the platform use their allowed default IDs. Possible values: force (perform the adaptation always), disabled (do not perform adaptation)

allowInsecureImages.description: Allows the use of the Camunda build Keycloak image (including the Management Identity login theme)

digest.description: can be used to set image digest (overrides tag if set, e.g. "sha256:abcd...")
can be used to set image digest (overrides tag if set, e.g. "sha256:abcd...")

existingSecret.description: defines the existing secret resource containing the database credentials

adminPasswordKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object for PostgreSQL admin.

userPasswordKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object for PostgreSQL user.

enabled.description: enabling tls

httpRelativePath.description: defines the context for Keycloak. This config is valid for Keycloak v19.x.x only

extraEnvVars.description: can be used set extra environment variables to be set on Keycloak container.

enabled.description: can be used enable ingress record generation for Keycloak.

tls.description: can be used to enable TLS configuration for the host defined at ingress.hostname parameter.

extraTls.description: configuration for additional hostnames to be covered with this ingress record.

type.description: can be set to change the service type.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reuse an existing secret containing authentication information.

passwordSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

enabled.description: if true, the Console deployment and its related resources are deployed via a helm release

configuration.description: Configuration passed directly to Console as YAML file. More details on [Console official documenations](https://docs.camunda.io/docs/self-managed/console-deployment/configuration/)

overrideConfiguration.description: When populated, it will override the configuration passed to Console, either auto-generated configuration or passed via `console.configuration`

registry.description: can be used to set container image registry.

repository.description: defines which image repository to use

tag.description: can be used to set the Docker image tag for the Console image (overwrites global.image.tag)

digest.description: can be used to set image digest (overrides tag if set, e.g. "sha256:abcd...")

pullSecrets.description: can be used to configure image pull secrets https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

sidecars.description: can be used to attach extra containers to the console deployment

enabled.description: Enable TLS traffic for console

existingSecret.description: The name of the existing secret that contains the TLS certificates. Each key of the secret corresponds to a certificate filename, and each value of a key corresponds to the content of the certificate file.

realm.description: Specifies the Keycloak realm used for authentication.

contextPath.description: can be used to make Console web application works on a custom sub-path. This is mainly used to run Camunda web applications under a single domain.

initContainers.description: can be used to set up extra init containers for the application Pod

podAnnotations.description: can be used to define extra Console pod annotations

podLabels.description: can be used to define extra Console pod labels

logging.description: configuration for the Console logging. This template will be directly included in the configuration YAML file

annotations.description: can be used to define annotations, which will be applied to the Console service

type.description: defines the type of the service https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#publishing-services-service-types

port.description: defines the port number where the web application will be available

serverName.description: defines the port name where the web application will be available

managementPort.description: defines the management port used to access metrics and app status

env.description: can be used to set extra environment variables in the app container. See the documentation https://docs.camunda.io/docs/self-managed/identity/deployment/configuration-variables/ for more details.

valueFrom.description: Source for the environment variable's value

envFrom.description: list of environment variables to import from configMapRef and secretRef

command.description: can be used to override the default command provided by the container image. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/

extraVolumes.description: can be used to define extra volumes for the Console pods, useful for TLS and self-signed certificates

extraVolumeMounts.description: can be used to mount extra volumes for the Console pods, useful for TLS and self-signed certificates

enabled.description: if true, the startup probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe scheme used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the startup probe route used on the app

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be marked as ready, after failure

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the Pod will be marked Unready

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

enabled.description: if true, the readiness probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe scheme used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the readiness probe route used on the app

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be marked as ready, after failure

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the Pod will be marked Unready

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

enabled.description: if true, the liveness probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe scheme used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the liveness probe route used on the app

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be considered successful after having failed

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the container will be restarted

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

enabled.description: if true, enables the Console service account

name.description: can be used to set the name of the Console service account

annotations.description: can be used to set the annotations of the service account

automountServiceAccountToken.description: can be used to control whether the service account token should be automatically mounted

nodeSelector.description: can be used to define on which nodes the Console pods should run

tolerations.description: can be used to define pod toleration's https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/

affinity.description: can be used to define pod affinity or anti-affinity https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/#affinity-and-anti-affinity

enabled.description: if true, the WebModeler deployment and its related resources are deployed via a helm release

fullnameOverride.description: can be used to override the full name of the WebModeler resources

nameOverride.description: can be used to partly override the name of the WebModeler resources (names will still be prefixed with the release name)

registry.description: can be used to set the Docker registry for the WebModeler images (overwrites global.image.registry)

tag.description: can be used to set the Docker image tag for the WebModeler images (overwrites global.image.tag)

pullSecrets.description: can be used to configure image pull secrets, see https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

contextPath.description: can be used to make WebModeler available on a custom sub-path. This is mainly used to run the Camunda web applications under a single domain.

method.description: defines the authentication method which should be used. Possible values: `basic`, `oidc`, or `none`. It could be used to override `global.security.authentication.method`.

repository.description: defines which image repository to use for the restapi Docker image

digest.description: can be used to set image digest (overrides tag if set, e.g. "sha256:abcd...")

sidecars.description: can be used to attach extra containers to the restapi deployment

initContainers.description: can be used to set up extra init containers for the application Pod

url.description: defines the JDBC url of the database instance.

host.description: Database host (used when url is not provided)

port.description: Database port number (used when url is not provided)

database.description: The database name (used when url is not provided)

password.description: (DEPRECATED - use webModeler.restapi.externalDatabase.secret instead) can be used to provide the database user's password; ignored if `webModeler.restapi.externalDatabase.existingSecret` is set

existingSecretPasswordKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use webModeler.restapi.externalDatabase.secret instead) string Key in the Secret data that holds the DB password; defaults to `"password"`.

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the password as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the password.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

smtpHost.description: defines the host name of the SMTP server to be used by WebModeler

smtpPort.description: defines the port number of the SMTP server

smtpUser.description: can be used to provide a user for the SMTP server

smtpPassword.description: (DEPRECATED - use webModeler.restapi.mail.secret instead) can be used to provide a password for the SMTP server; ignored if `webModeler.restapi.mail.existingSecret` is set

smtpTlsEnabled.description: if true, enforces TLS encryption for SMTP connections (using STARTTLS)

existingSecretPasswordKey.description: (DEPRECATED - use webModeler.restapi.mail.secret instead) can be used to provide the name of an existing secret key containing the SMTP password

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the SMTP password as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the SMTP password.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

fromAddress.description: defines the email address that will be displayed as the sender of emails sent by WebModeler

fromName.description: defines the name that will be displayed as the sender of emails sent by WebModeler

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the Pusher app secret as a plain-text value for non-production usage

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the Pusher app secret

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object

clusters.description: can be used to configure Camunda 8 clusters that will be available in Web Modeler (will override default cluster configuration that is used if `orchestration.enabled=true`)

podLabels.description: can be used to define extra restapi pod labels

scheme.description: defines the startup probe schema used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the HTTP endpoint used for the startup probe

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before the probe is initiated

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often the probe needs to succeed to be considered successful after having failed

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered failed so the container will be restarted

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after which the probe times out

enabled.description: if true, a PostgreSQL database will be deployed as part of the Helm release by using the dependency chart

adaptSecurityContext.description: Adapt the securityContext sections of the deployment to make them compatible with Openshift restricted-v2 SCC: remove runAsUser, runAsGroup and fsGroup and let the platform use their allowed default IDs. Possible values: force (perform the adaptation always), disabled (do not perform adaptation)

nameOverride.description: defines the name of the Postgres resources (names will be prefixed with the release name), see https://github.com/bitnami/charts/tree/main/bitnami/postgresql#common-parameters

digest.description: can be used to set image digest (overrides tag if set, e.g. "sha256:abcd...")

username.description: defines the name of the database user to be created for WebModeler

password.description: can be used to provide the database user's password; a random password will be generated if left empty / ignored if `postgresql.auth.existingSecret` is set

database.description: defines the name of the database to be created for WebModeler

existingSecret.description: can be used to provide the name of an existing secret resource containing the database password

adminPasswordKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object for PostgreSQL admin.

userPasswordKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object for PostgreSQL user.

enabled.description: if true, the Connectors deployment and its related resources are deployed via a helm release

method.description: defines the authentication method which should be used. Possible values: `basic`, `oidc`, or `none`. It could be used to override `global.security.authentication.method`.

clientId.description: defines the client id, which is used by Connectors in authentication flows.

tokenScope.description: defines the token scope, which is used by Connectors.

method.description: defines the authentication method which should be used. Possible values: `basic`, `oidc`, or `none`. It could be used to override `global.security.authentication.method`.

unprotectedApi.description: if true, then allow unauthenticated API access.

authenticationRefreshInterval.description: defines the session's authentication refresh time, defaulted to PT30S.

usernameClaim.description: can be used to set username claim.

preferUsernameClaim.description: can be used to set OIDC prefer-username-claim.

clientIdClaim.description: can be used to set client ID claim.

groupsClaim.description: can be used to set group claim.

audience.description: defines the audience, which is used by Orchestration Cluster.

scope.description: defines a list of scopes to request in the OIDC token. If not set, it will use the application defaults.

backwardsCompatibleAudiences.description: defines audiences, which need to be set for backwards compatibility to allow the access the Orchestration Cluster. This is only important and set if you're coming from an earlier version

clientId.description: defines the client id, which is used by Orchestration Cluster in authentication flows.

redirectUrl.description: defines the root (or redirect) URL, which is used by Keycloak to access Tasklist.

maxRetries.description: can be used to define the maximum amount of retries.

enabled.description: if true, the migration of Management Identity data to the orchestration clusters Identity occurs

registry.description: can be used to set container image registry.

repository.description: defines which image repository to use

tag.description: can be set to overwrite the global tag, which should be used in that chart

digest.description: can be used to set image digest (overrides tag if set, e.g. "sha256:abcd...")

backoffLimit.description: can be used to specify the backoffLimit for the job https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/job/#pod-backoff-failure-policy

resourceAuthorizationsEnabled.description: if true, the migration of Management Identity data to the orchestration cluster will not create wildcard resource access for roles, this is required to be true if Resource Based Access was used with 8.7

claimName.description: (OIDC setups only) defines the claim name in the Access Token to authorize the client by. This is required to grant the migration client the identity read permissions.

claimValue.description: (OIDC setups only) defines the claim value in the set claimName that identifies the migration client. This is required to grant the migration client the identity read permissions.

clientId.description: must be the clientId used by the migration to access Management Identity. Only needed if external IdP is used (requires read permission).

inlineSecret.description: can be used to provide the client secret as a plain-text value for non-production usage.

existingSecret.description: can be used to reference an existing Kubernetes Secret containing the client secret.

existingSecretKey.description: defines the key within the existing secret object.

env.description: can be used to set extra environment variables in the identity migration job container

envFrom.description: list of environment variables to import from configMapRef and secretRef

extraVolumes.description: can be used to define extra volumes for the importer pod

extraVolumeMounts.description: can be used to mount extra volumes for the importer pod

sidecars.description: can be used to attach extra containers to the deployment

enabled.description: if true, then enable multitenancy checks in all applicable components.
if true, then enable multitenancy API used for tenant management.

clusterSize.description: defines the amount of brokers (=replicas), which are deployed via helm

partitionCount.description: defines how many partitions are set up in the cluster

replicationFactor.description: defines how each partition is replicated, the value defines the number of nodes

env.description: can be used to set extra environment variables in the app container. See the documentation https://docs.camunda.io/docs/self-managed/identity/deployment/configuration-variables/ for more details.

valueFrom.description: Source for the environment variable's value

envFrom.description: list of environment variables to import from configMapRef and secretRef

defaultMode.description: can be used to set permissions on created files by default. Must be an octal value between 0000 and 0777 or a decimal value between 0 and 511. see https://github.com/kubernetes/api/blob/master/core/v1/types.go#L1615-L1623

command.description: can be used to override the default command provided by the container image. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/

logLevel.description: defines the log level which is used

log4j2.description: can be used to overwrite the log4j2 configuration

javaOpts.description: can be used to set java options

annotations.description: can be used to define annotations, which will be applied to the service
can be used to define annotations, which will be applied to the headless service

type.description: defines the type of the service https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#publishing-services-service-types

loadBalancerIP.description: defines public IP of the load balancer if the type is LoadBalancer

loadBalancerSourceRanges.description: defines list of allowed source IP address ranges if the type is LoadBalancer

httpName.description: defines the name of the http endpoint, where for example metrics are provided

httpPort.description: defines the port of the http endpoint, where for example metrics are provided

managementName.description: defines the name of the management endpoint, where the management API is exposed

managementPort.description: defines the port of the management endpoint, where the management API is exposed

grpcName.description: defines the name of the gateway gRPC endpoint, where client commands (grpc) are sent to

grpcPort.description: defines the port of the gateway gRPC endpoint, where client commands (grpc) are sent to

commandName.description: defines the name of the command API endpoint, where the broker commands are sent to

commandPort.description: defines the port of the command API endpoint, where the broker commands are sent to

internalName.description: defines the name of the internal API endpoint, which is used for internal communication

internalPort.description: defines the port of the internal API endpoint, which is used for internal communication

extraPorts.description: can be used to expose any other ports which are required. Can be useful for exporters

enabled.description: if true, enables the broker service account

name.description: can be used to set the name of the broker service account

annotations.description: can be used to set the annotations of the broker service account

automountServiceAccountToken.description: can be used to control whether the service account token should be automatically mounted

enabled.description: if true, an ingress resource is deployed with the Zeebe gateway deployment. Only useful if an ingress controller is available, like nginx.

external.description: if true, the Ingress object will not be rendered. This setting is used when a non-Ingress resource, like a service mesh, is used to access the cluster.

className.description: defines the class or configuration of ingress which should be used by the controller

path.description: defines the path which is associated with the Zeebe gateway's gRPC service and port https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/ingress/#ingress-rules

pathType.description: can be used to define the Ingress path type. https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/ingress/#path-types

host.description: can be used to define the host of the ingress rule. https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/ingress/#ingress-rules

enabled.description: if true, then tls is configured on the ingress resource. If enabled the Ingress.host need to be defined.

secretName.description: defines the secret name which contains the TLS private key and certificate

contextPath.description: can be used to make Orchestration Cluster web application works on a custom sub-path. This is mainly used to run Camunda web applications under a single domain.

cpuThreadCount.description: defines how many threads can be used for the processing on each broker pod

ioThreadCount.description: defines how many threads can be used for the exporting on each broker pod

persistenceType.description: defines the type of persistence which is used by orchestration. Possible values are: disk, local and memory.

pvcSize.description: defines the persistent volume claim size, which is used by each broker pod https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#persistentvolumeclaims

pvcAccessModes.description: can be used to configure the persistent volume claim access mode https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#access-modes

pvcStorageClassName.description: can be used to set the storage class name which should be used by the persistent volume claim.

pvcAnnotations.description: can be used to specify custom annotations for persistent volume claims, enhancing storage configuration flexibility.

pvcSelector.description: can be used to specify a label selector for persistent volume claims for further filtering of the set of persistent volumes to select.

snapshotPeriod.description: defines the period, after which a snapshot is created https://docs.camunda.io/docs/self-managed/zeebe-deployment/configuration/broker-config/#zeebebrokerdata

processing.description: the minimum free space which should be available on the disk, before the broker stops processing commands https://docs.camunda.io/docs/self-managed/zeebe-deployment/configuration/broker-config/#zeebebrokerdatadiskfreespace

replication.description: the minimum free space which should be available on the disk, before the broker stops receicing replicated events https://docs.camunda.io/docs/self-managed/zeebe-deployment/configuration/broker-config/#zeebebrokerdatadiskfreespace

extraVolumes.description: can be used to define extra volumes for the broker pods, useful for additional exporters

extraVolumeMounts.description: can be used to mount extra volumes for the broker pods, useful for additional exporters

extraInitContainers.description: (DEPRECATED - use `initContainers` instead) can be used to set up extra init containers for the broker pods, useful for additional exporters

initContainers.description: can be used to set up extra init containers for the application Pod

podAnnotations.description: can be used to define extra broker pod annotations

podLabels.description: can be used to define extra broker pod labels

enabled.description: if true a pod disruption budget is defined for the brokers

minAvailable.description: can be used to set how many pods should be available. Be aware that if minAvailable is set, maxUnavailable will not be set (they are mutually exclusive).

maxUnavailable.description: can be used to set how many pods should be at max. unavailable

enabled.description: if true, the startup probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe schema used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the startup probe route used on the app

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before the probe is initiated.

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be marked as ready, after failure

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the Pod will be marked Unready

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

enabled.description: if true, the readiness probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe schema used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the readiness probe route used on the app

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be marked as ready, after failure

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the Pod will be marked Unready

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

enabled.description: if true, the liveness probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe schema used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the liveness probe route used on the app. The path is intended to be the same as the readinessProbe. Refer to this issue for more details: https://github.com/camunda/camunda-platform-helm/issues/1849

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be considered successful after having failed

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the container will be restarted

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

nodeSelector.description: can be used to define on which nodes the broker pods should run

tolerations.description: can be used to define pod toleration's https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/

priorityClassName.description: can be used to define the broker pods priority https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/pod-priority-preemption/#priorityclass

enabled.description: if true, enables the new Camunda exporter.
if true, enables the legacy Zeebe Elasticsearch and OpenSearch exporters.

prefix.description: if specified, defines an index prefix in Elasticsearch/OpenSearch for the new exporter and Orchestration Cluster. For old exporter or Optimize use the "global.elasticsearch.prefix" or OpenSearch equivalent.

replicas.description: can be used to specify the number of replicas for indices in Elasticsearch/OpenSearch

enabled.description: if true, the ILM Policy is created and applied to the index templates.

minimumAge.description: defines how old the data must be, before the data is deleted as a duration.

policyName.description: defines the name of the created and applied ILM policy.

elsRolloverDateFormat.description: defines the date format of historical indices in a Java DateTimeFormatter compliant syntax.

rolloverInterval.description: defines the time range of the historical indices to be created.

rolloverBatchSize.description: defines the maximum number of process instances per batch during archiving.

waitPeriodBeforeArchiving.description: defines the grace period for processes to be excluded from archiving for a value of 1h, any processes completed in

delayBetweenRuns.description: the millisecond interval between archiver runs

maxDelayBetweenRuns.description: the maximum millisecond interval between archiver runs due to failure backoffs

enabled.description: if true, applies ILM Policy to the archived orchestration indices (operate, tasklist, camunda).

minimumAge.description: defines how old the data must be, before the data is deleted as a duration.

policyName.description: defines the name of the created and applied ILM policy.

usageMetricsMinimumAge.description: defines how old the usage metric indices must be before deletion (camunda-usage-metric, camunda-usage-metric-tu).

usageMetricsPolicyName.description: defines the name of the created and applied ILM policy to usage metric indices.

configuration.description: if specified, contents will be used as the application.yaml

extraConfiguration.description: if specified, contents will be used for any extra configuration files such as log4j2.xml

extraVolumeClaimTemplates.description: can be used to specify an array of extra PersistentVolumeClaim templates to be appended to the StatefulSet's volumeClaimTemplates. WARNING: volumeClaimTemplates is immutable after creation; changing this requires manual intervention (such as deleting the StatefulSet and its PVCs). Use with caution!

allowPreReleaseImages.description: if true, allows the use of pre-release images for the orchestration cluster. Prerelease images are, by their nature, unstable and should be used with caution. This flag should only be used for testing purposes.

enabled.description: if true, the Optimize deployment and its related resources are deployed via a helm release

registry.description: can be used to set container image registry

repository.description: defines which image repository to use

tag.description: can be set to overwrite the global tag, which should be used in that chart

digest.description: can be used to set image digest (overrides tag if set, e.g. "sha256:abcd...")

pullSecrets.description: can be used to configure image pull secrets https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

enabled.description: if true, run Optimize migration script as an init container

env.description: can be used to set extra environment variables in the app container. See the documentation https://docs.camunda.io/docs/self-managed/identity/deployment/configuration-variables/ for more details. (Note: there is no need to define this if optimize.env is defined)

sidecars.description: can be used to attach extra containers to the optimize deployment

contextPath.description: can be used to make Optimize web application works on a custom sub-path. This is mainly used to run Camunda web applications under a single domain.

defaultMode.description: can be used to set permissions on created files by default. Must be an octal value between 0000 and 0777 or a decimal value between 0 and 511.

podAnnotations.description: can be used to define extra Optimize pod annotations

podLabels.description: can be used to define extra Optimize pod labels

logLevel.description: configuration for the optimize runtime environment. https://docs.camunda.io/optimize/next/self-managed/optimize-deployment/configuration/logging/

upgradeLogLevel.description: sets the logging level for the Optimize update log. https://docs.camunda.io/optimize/next/self-managed/optimize-deployment/configuration/logging/

esLogLevel.description: sets the logging level for Elasticsearch. https://docs.camunda.io/optimize/next/self-managed/optimize-deployment/configuration/logging/

partitionCount.description: defines how many Zeebe partitions are set up in the cluster and which should be imported by Optimize

env.description: can be used to set extra environment variables in the app container. See the documentation https://docs.camunda.io/docs/self-managed/identity/deployment/configuration-variables/ for more details.

valueFrom.description: Source for the environment variable's value

envFrom.description: list of environment variables to import from configMapRef and secretRef

command.description: can be used to override the default command provided by the container image. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/

extraVolumes.description: can be used to define extra volumes for the Optimize pods, useful for tls and self-signed certificates

extraVolumeMounts.description: can be used to mount extra volumes for the Optimize pods, useful for tls and self-signed certificates

initContainers.description: can be used to set up extra init containers for the application Pod

enabled.description: if true, enables the Optimize service account

name.description: can be used to set the name of the Optimize service account

annotations.description: can be used to set the annotations of the Optimize service account

automountServiceAccountToken.description: can be used to control whether the service account token should be automatically mounted

annotations.description: can be used to define annotations, which will be applied to the Optimize service

type.description: defines the type of the service https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#publishing-services-service-types

port.description: defines the port of the service, where the Optimize web application will be available

managementPort.description: defines the port where actuator will be available. Also required to reach backup API

enabled.description: if true, the startup probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe schema used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the startup probe route used on the app

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be marked as ready, after failure

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the Pod will be marked Unready

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

enabled.description: if true, the readiness probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe schema used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the readiness probe route used on the app

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be marked as ready, after failure

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the Pod will be marked Unready

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

enabled.description: if true, the liveness probe is enabled in app container

scheme.description: defines the startup probe schema used on calling the probePath

probePath.description: defines the liveness probe route used on the app

initialDelaySeconds.description: defines the number of seconds after the container has started before

periodSeconds.description: defines how often the probe is executed

successThreshold.description: defines how often it needs to be true to be considered successful after having failed

failureThreshold.description: defines when the probe is considered as failed so the container will be restarted

timeoutSeconds.description: defines the seconds after the probe times out

nodeSelector.description: can be used to define on which nodes the Optimize pods should run

tolerations.description: can be used to define pod toleration's https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/

affinity.description: can be used to define pod affinity or anti-affinity https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/#affinity-and-anti-affinity

configuration.description: if specified, contents will be used as the environment-config.yaml

extraConfiguration.description: if specified, contents will be used for any extra configuration files such as environment-logback.xml

enabled.description: can be used to create a PVC for persistent storage instead of using emptyDir

size.description: can be used to define the size of the persistent volume claim

accessModes.description: can be used to define the access modes for the persistent volume claim

storageClassName.description: can be used to define the storage class to use for the persistent volume claim

existingClaim.description: can be used to specify an existing PVC instead of creating a new one

annotations.description: can be used to define annotations to add to the persistent volume claim

selector.description: can be used to define a label selector for the persistent volume claim

valueFrom.description: Source for the environment variable's value

adaptSecurityContext.description: Adapt the securityContext sections of the deployment to make them compatible with Openshift restricted-v2 SCC: remove runAsUser, runAsGroup and fsGroup and let the platform use their allowed default IDs. Possible values: force (perform the adaptation always), disabled (do not perform adaptation)

digest.description: can be used to set image digest (overrides tag if set, e.g. "sha256:abcd...")

replicaCount.description: defines number of master-elegible replicas to deploy

podAntiAffinityPreset.description: defines Pod anti-affinity preset. Ignored if master.affinity is set

enabled.description: if true then a service monitor will be deployed, which allows an installed prometheus controller to scrape metrics from the deployed pods

scrapeInterval.description: can be set to configure the interval at which metrics should be scraped
